result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory Howard Meyer

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

01:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cory Howard Meyer appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Cory Howard Meyer. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.
records.courtRptr: D Nelson / J Klaren / M Lindbloom

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on July 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Warrant recalled.  Bond reinstated.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
